speaker: Ethan
text: I wanted to check on your progress with the integration tests. Have you run into anything?
ipa: aɪ ˈwɑːntɪd tə tʃɛk ɒn jɔː ˈprəʊɡrɛs wɪð ði ˌɪntɪˈɡreɪʃən tɛsts. hæv juː rʌn ˈɪntuː ˈɛnɪθɪŋ?
stress: I WANTED to CHECK on your PROGRESS with the INTEGRATION TESTS. Have you RUN into ANYTHING?
linking:
"wanted to" → /ˈwɑːntɪd tə/ (d + t linking)
"run into" → /rʌn ˈɪntuː/ (n + i linking)

speaker: Nina
text: Yeah — I’ve been worried about the flaky results on staging. I apologised to the QA team this morning for not catching it sooner.
ipa: jæ — aɪv bɪn ˈwʌrid əˈbaʊt ðə ˈfleɪki rɪˈzʌlts ɒn ˈsteɪdʒɪŋ. aɪ əˈpɒlədʒaɪzd tə ðə ˌkjuːˈeɪ tiːm ðɪs ˈmɔːnɪŋ fə nɒt ˈkætʃɪŋ ɪt ˈsuːnə.
stress: YEAH — I’ve been WORRIED about the FLAKY RESULTS on STAGING. I APOLOGISED to the QA TEAM this MORNING for not CATCHING it SOONER.
linking:
"been worried" → /bɪn ˈwʌrid/ (n + w linking)
"not catching" → /nɒt ˈkætʃɪŋ/ (t + c linking)

speaker: Ethan
text: I see. Were the failures related to the database timeout issue?
ipa: aɪ siː. wɜː ðə ˈfeɪljəz rɪˈleɪtɪd tə ðə ˈdeɪtəbeɪs ˈtaɪmaʊt ˈɪʃuː?
stress: I SEE. Were the FAILURES RELATED to the DATABASE TIMEOUT ISSUE?
linking:
"were the" → /wɜː ðə/ (r + th linking)
"database timeout" → /ˈdeɪtəbeɪs ˈtaɪmaʊt/ (s + t linking)

speaker: Nina
text: Exactly. I’ve been concentrating on mocking the external service calls to isolate the problem.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli. aɪv bɪn ˈkɒnsəntreɪtɪŋ ɒn ˈmɒkɪŋ ði ɪkˈstɜːnl ˈsɜːvɪs kɔːlz tʊ ˈaɪsəleɪt ðə ˈprɒbləm.
stress: EXACTLY. I’ve been CONCENTRATING on MOCKING the EXTERNAL SERVICE CALLS to ISOLATE the PROBLEM.
linking:
"been concentrating" → /bɪn ˈkɒnsəntreɪtɪŋ/ (n + c linking)
"service calls" → /ˈsɜːvɪs kɔːlz/ (s + c linking)

speaker: Ethan
text: Smart move. And thanks for being honest about the delay. Did anyone complain about the impact on the timeline?
ipa: smɑːt muːv. ənd θæŋks fə ˈbiːɪŋ ˈɒnɪst əˈbaʊt ðə dɪˈleɪ. dɪd ˈɛnɪwʌn kəmˈpleɪn əˈbaʊt ði ˈɪmpækt ɒn ðə ˈtaɪmlaɪn?
stress: SMART MOVE. And THANKS for being HONEST about the DELAY. Did ANYONE COMPLAIN about the IMPACT on the TIMELINE?
linking:
"thanks for" → /θæŋks fə/ (s + f linking)
"complain about" → /kəmˈpleɪn əˈbaʊt/ (n + a linking)

speaker: Nina
text: A bit. Marissa seemed annoyed with the lack of error logging. She even pointed at a line in the commit and said, “What’s this supposed to do?”
ipa: ə bɪt. məˈrɪsə siːmd əˈnɔɪd wɪð ðə læk əv ˈɛrə ˈlɒɡɪŋ. ʃiː ˈiːvən ˈpɔɪntɪd ət ə laɪn ɪn ðə kəˈmɪt ənd sɛd, “wɒts ðɪs səˈpəʊzd tə duː?”
stress: A BIT. Marissa SEEMED ANNOYED with the LACK of ERROR LOGGING. She EVEN POINTED at a LINE in the COMMIT and SAID, “WHAT’S this SUPPOSED to DO?”
linking:
"seemed annoyed" → /siːmd əˈnɔɪd/ (d + a linking)
"pointed at" → /ˈpɔɪntɪd ət/ (d + a linking)

speaker: Ethan
text: Classic Marissa. Just deal with it — she’s tough, but fair. If it helps, I can speak to her about giving feedback more tactfully.
ipa: ˈklæsɪk məˈrɪsə. dʒʌst diːl wɪð ɪt — ʃiːz tʌf, bət feə. ɪf ɪt hɛlps, aɪ kən spiːk tə hə əˈbaʊt ˈɡɪvɪŋ ˈfiːdbæk mɔː ˈtæktfəli.
stress: CLASSIC Marissa. Just DEAL with it — she’s TOUGH, but FAIR. If it HELPS, I can SPEAK to her about GIVING FEEDBACK more TACTFULLY.
linking:
"deal with" → /diːl wɪð/ (l + w linking)
"speak to" → /spiːk tə/ (k + t linking)

speaker: Nina
text: Thanks, that’d be nice of you. I don’t mind feedback — I just prefer it in private.
ipa: θæŋks, ðæt bi naɪs əv juː. aɪ dəʊnt maɪnd ˈfiːdbæk — aɪ dʒʌst prɪˈfɜːr ɪt ɪn ˈpraɪvət.
stress: THANKS, that’d be NICE of YOU. I DON’T MIND FEEDBACK — I just PREFER it in PRIVATE.
linking:
"nice of" → /naɪs əv/ (s + o linking)
"prefer it" → /prɪˈfɜːr ɪt/ (r + i linking)
